job_title: Operations Coordinator in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Management is very understanding and supportive of career goals.  Wonderful benefits including a generous vacation package.
cons: Every department is different.   Luckily I currently work for a great department, but came from one that had issues with the business manager and created a tense work environment.

review_title: Great place to do research but it really boils down to your relationship with the PI
job_title: Postdoctoral Research Associate in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Incredible amount of intellectual and technical support that results in interdepartmental collaboration.
cons: Once you sign the offer letter there is no annual raise in your salary.  You only get cost of living adjustment which is usually 1.25%.

job_title: Bioinformaticist in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Smart and nice people, excellent research groups, good training, always lots of research activities going on. good benefits (22 paid vacation days), kids are free of tuition to attend the college if employed for a few years.
cons: Relatively low pay; modest annual salary increase; location of the small city; too far away from any big cities and tourism sites.

review_title: Great place to work if you want to stay put
job_title: PC Support Specialist in Saint Louis, MO
pros:
* Very, very smart people, at all levels
* Lots of interesting technical and scientific problems to solve
* Excellent benefits - health/dental/vision, 403(b), tuition, housing purchase assistance
cons:
* No chance for mobility. Management would rather hire external candidates than capitalize on the expertise they already have.
* Salaries stagnated the last two years I was there.

review_title: Great place to work and grow a career.
job_title: Staff Scientist in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Excellent work atmosphere.  Plenty of interesting things going on and very interesting colleagues. Excellent healthcare/insurance benefits.  Good vacation.
cons: Job /position security can be at the mercy of grant funding levels and availability, which is not what it used to be.

job_title: Graduate Student in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Great people to learn and work with, and greater research happening here! Proud to be training with the best in the nation, and being top10 in graduate program
cons: WashU are letting many great people to leave this school,  other schools seems to come here and recruiting them all out. I wonder this will have a impact coming soon.

job_title: Faculty Member (Instructor) in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Best place for pre-clinical or clinical research. The group has many wonderful expertise to work with. Very good benefit for your child tuition fee of college.
cons: Sometimes the managements need to improve. You have to work at least for 6 years for the student tuition fee benefit.

review_title: As a Ph.D. student, I had highs and lows, it depends on who your Ph.D. advisor is.
job_title: Ph D Student in Saint Louis, MO
pros: high quality academics; leading researchers; friendly people; excellent facilities; gorgeous campus
cons: some people are not friendly; ambitious; competitive; not great name recognition in some areas

job_title: Research Technician in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Advancing medicine through laboratory and clinical research is very rewarding. The benefits package is also very generous, especially for health and employee/children education benefits.
cons: In finding a healthy work-life balance, you may find many positions are leaning towards too much work. Be firm when finding a work-life balance that is both healthy for you and productive for your employer.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Best benefits I have ever seen: over a month of vacation/sick time annually, amazing vision/dental/health, GREAT matching for 403b, and free undergrad tuition for returning to school!
cons: Turnover is low, so hard to move up within the company if you don't have a higher education degree

job_title: Manager in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Great vacation, healthcare and sick leave policy.  Pay is competitive
cons: Parking is terrible and costs too much. Multiple locations to navigate throughout the various offices and other campus around the city.

job_title: Consulting Group Analyst in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Relatively low stress, academic environment.  Good benefits including tuition reimbursement for dependents.  The campus is a nice place to work.
cons: Staff positions seem to pay less on average than non-academic equivalents in industry.  Many department heads and faculty do not play well with others which results in infighting, inefficiency, and low morale among the staff.

review_title: A great couple of years working for WUSTL school of medicine
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Washington University in Saint Louis School of Medicine is a fantastic place to work. Smart people and the best technology combine to make a very productive work environment.
cons: I need twenty words but I do not have any bad things to say about Washington University in Saint Louis.

review_title: Being a master's student at Wash U was great.
job_title: Graduate Student in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Small class sizes, approachable faculty, and experts in various industries all contributed to a positive experience. Additionally the class schedules worked around my full-time job.
cons: Not many cons to speak of regarding the university. I enjoyed my experience. I do wish that I had participated in more extra curricular activities.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Exciting research. Mostly great benefits. Work/life balance was ok. Good opportunity to interact with other researchers.
cons: Very difficult to advance or transfer to another department. Department was very cliquey. Didn't feel like environment was very inclusive. Sometimes work load could be very high.

job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator II in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Great vacation and holiday time available to employees and benefits are nice as well. Incredibly interesting and insightful research is ongoing.
cons: Managers aren't monitored or held accountable for their behavior. HR is a joke. Difficult to grow professionally unless you are a MD or PhD

job_title: Senior Lecturer in Saint Louis, MO
pros:
Outstanding benefits, including childcare assistance, discounts at on-campus stores and restaurants (through Bear Bucks), medical/dental/vision.

My compensation is exceptional, but it's not typical among lecturers at the university. I've won several teaching awards, and they clearly value that.
cons: Academic culture is always a bit challenging. Things move slowly, and don't always seem to be logical.

job_title: Research Technician II in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Great atmosphere, very diverse community, room to grow especially from an entry level position, lots of seminars and talks for employees to attend, give employees free yearly metro link passes
cons: Parking is disgusting - the cheapest parking garage on the medical campus is $75 per month. To get around that I take the metro

review_title: Fulfilling Summer Job for WashU Students
job_title: WashU Summer Experiences Program Assistant in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Lots of support from cohort members and supervisors, very rewarding to bond with residents, learn and practice valuable mediation/facilitation skills
cons: If you also work during the day, there is little "down" time, strict rules about remaining on campus in the evenings and weekends

job_title: Postdoctoral Research Associate in Saint Louis, MO
pros:
Good people
Environment that fosters creative research
Good post-doctoral society support and career search support
Good access to materials and machinery
cons: The medical school is a top 10 so advisers can be over committed and difficult to sit down with to get input or feed back from.

review_title: A good place to work if you don't mind being stuck in your position.
job_title: Senior Web Developer in Saint Louis, MO
pros: The work culture is relatively low stress. The full time work week is 37.5 hours.
cons: The pay is on the low side.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Louis, MO
pros: As an entry level employee, there has been a lot of emphasis on career development within my department. I have been able to learn a TON of professional skills that I wouldn't have otherwise
cons: Many holidays are not officially scheduled days off, and the expectation is often that employees will use their vacation days.

job_title: Work Study Employee in Clayton, MO
pros: I was able to have an amazing and great work experience while staying on campus and taking classes! Hooray hooray
cons: Little challenge, low pay, little room for promotion - Difficult to balance work, school and social aspects of life

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Great university community, professional development
cons: Decentralized, discrepancy between hourly and exempt pay

job_title: Student Administrator in Saint Louis, MO
pros: convenience, people are super nice since the people work with students are always nice. It will be a perfect place for international student to have experience.
cons: Salary a little bit low compare to other universities. At other state, the salary is almost 12-15 hour for a student worker.

job_title: Workstudy Student in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Changing between work/study jobs is never a huge problem, and they are always flexible with your schedule, which is really nice!
cons: The jobs vary so much while the pay is more or less the same, so be aware of when you pick a work/study job and consider the other factors that come into play

job_title: Editor in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Great benefits, beautiful campus, positive attitude in co-workers and boss, nice collaborative atmosphere. I worked in several public relations departments and had a great experience in each. The low turnover rate is proof that this is a good place to work, and where employees are valued highly.
cons: Parking is a pain but otherwise no cons.

job_title: Project Director in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Very high quality institution and output. Many employee benefits including tuition for dependents. Opportunities to move laterally within the institution. Great location next to Forest Park.
cons: The Institution is bureaucratic and very hierarchical. The place and people can be snotty as illustrated through its nickname in my title. The campus is very insular.

job_title: Studio TA in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Great, everyone is very friendly and willing to help out. The environment is positive and encouraging.
cons: There can be issues with reaching people, not everyone responds to emails in a timely manner, or even at all. There are also a number of times when there is red tape that makes getting things done difficult.

job_title: in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Good Medical School and Undergraduate program.  Good working surrounding areas access to shops, cafes etc  Good benefits.  Easy to commute to by public transportation.
cons: Low salaries in general.  Low job security but on par with most places of employment.  Potential for advancement is almost non-existent.

job_title: Research Assistant in Saint Louis, MO
pros: You need to tackle new and challenging problems everyday. Time schedule is flexible. You can work from home if you work property allows. Community is good.
cons: Salary is low. But considering the gain of knowledge and people relationships, it's well worthy of it.

review_title: A great place to do research over the summer
job_title: Research Assistant in Saint Louis, MO
pros: The professor I did research under (CS department) was brilliant and extremely involved and helping me prepare for graduate school, Beautiful Campus, Very smart co-workers
cons: It's in St. Louis, which doesn't have as much going on as a larger city like Chicago or New York

review_title: I work in the Washington University Career Center which is a fabulous office.
job_title: Career Consultant in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Great coworkers, great location and beautiful campus.  Working with students and helping them is very fun and fulfilling. Lots of resources.
cons: Because I work part time, I am not eligible for the generous benefits that WU offers to full time employees.

job_title: Project Manager in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Great pay, generous vacation policy, good benefits all around.
cons: It has lost much of it's "academic" environment since 1995 and is now being run much more like a corporation.  In previous years, the students and employees were the most important, but that is no longer the case.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Wonderful company benefits: Retirement Savings Plan (403b), 22 vacation days, 8 Paid Holidays, Sick Time, Tuition benefits for employee, spouse and dependent children, Free Metro Link/ Bus pass, Free Life Insurance, Health, Dental, Vision, Health Savings Accounts (HSA), Long Term Disability Insurance, Flex Spending Plan, Employee Assistance Program.
cons: Employees have to pay to park.

job_title: Communications Officer in Saint Louis, MO
pros: In my humble opinion Washington University is a phenomenal place to work.  I am very pleased with the atmosphere, my co-workers, and managers.  I can't say enough good things about the benefits the university provides.
cons: I only have only found a few minor issues but nothing to speak of.

job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Collaborate directly with the Principal Investigator(s), Varied duties, Sense of ownership, Grant writing exposure, Casual environment
cons: Experience depends on study design (which depends on Principal Investigator). Slow pace is accepted. If you take over for a former coordinator, you will inherit their potentially poor organization and materials. Low collaboration between coordinators.

review_title: Great employer with opportunity of growth and challenge
job_title: Project Manager in Saint Louis, MO
pros: The environment is flexible and encourages creative solutions, leveraging current technology and developing technology
cons: Working in an academic environment can mean that essential business offices are close early and are unavaiable when needed.

job_title: Research Technician in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Great benefits, ample amount of vacation days, and a top rated research location. The campus is pleasant  and there are opportunities to be more involved in education, take classes etc.
cons: Even with a lot of backing from my boss Washington University doesn't like to give promotions. There's no room for growth.

job_title: Research Assistant in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Very beneficial environment to work in. The faculty and staff are all extremely helpful towards making sure you feel comfortable and well-informed about the work that is going on in the lab.
cons: The pay could be a little bit better and the hours were sometimes a little bit longer than expected.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Saint Louis, MO
pros: WUSTL offers wonderful benefits to its employers, health plans, generous vacation days, friendly work environment
cons: Salary is commensurate with the cost-of-living in St. Louis, adding a low-ball sticker shock for many in academia. Parking on campus for employees is some of the worst you'll ever have!

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Saint Louis, MO
pros: WUSTL offers wonderful benefits to its employers, health plans, generous vacation days, friendly work environment
cons: Salary is commensurate with the cost-of-living in St. Louis, adding a low-ball sticker shock for many in academia. Parking on campus for employees is some of the worst you'll ever have!

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Saint Louis, MO
pros:
As an academic institute, Washington University in St. Louis supports some of the best research in many academic areas. 
The living expense in St. Louis is low, and life style here is good for academic research.
cons: The university is not as well known as some other universities of its similar level.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Great Benefits, large organization, room to move laterally, highly respected academic institution
cons: Little room to move vertically, annual raise is typically 2%, promotions are hard to come by and negotiating salary increase is rarely successful

job_title: Clinical Research Data Assistant in Saint Louis, MO
pros: You earn sick time and vacation time with each paycheck - even as a part time employee! And you get all holidays paid. Amazing! Super flexible since I'm a student.
cons: None that I have encountered. My position is grant funded, and my position is up when funding is up - sadly :(

job_title: Web Development in Saint Louis, MO
pros:
Higher ed environment
promoting sustainability
good benefits
cons:
some degree of politics involved in all departments
must know someone who works at WashU to get a job

review_title: Research Assistant, Department of Computer Science And Engineering
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Saint Louis, MO
pros:
The school is very generous. Many changes to meet great students and faculty. Classes are excellent.
I love working with great and open-minded people here.
cons: It's pretty stressful and a lot of work there. The environment is extremely competitive.

review_title: I worked as an undergraduate research assistant at Biology department
job_title: Research Assistant in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Flexibility and being able to meet with different people in the research group. My P.I is extremely nice.
cons: You get minimum wage for doing research. It is a bit of ridiculous. But other than that it is great.

review_title: Very relaxed place to work part time
job_title: Student Worker in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Flexible scheduling and very nice group dynamics.  Everyone is super nice, and clients are (almost) always very easygoing.
cons: The work can be boring, especially when there isn't much to be done.  There's also no real opportunities for student workers to advance in the hierarchy.

review_title: Bioinformatics scientist in a group that studies cancer in search of druggable targets and early diagnoses
job_title: Staff Scientist in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Renowned. Great culture and attitude towards research and science. Cheap cost of living in the area. Great craft breweries nearby.
cons: St Louis crime rate is a sad story. Most employees live far away in walled suburbs.

review_title: Lots of opportunities for graduate students
job_title: Research Assistant in Saint Louis, MO
pros:
Lots of positions at the beginning of semesters.
Some managers and professors are very nice to work with.
Good research projects.
cons: Low pay comparing to universities in other regions. No benefits for part-time students at all. Student email accounts even do not have desktop software access which is ridiculous.

job_title: Postdoctoral Research Associate in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Highly funded research labs. Respected and recognised nationally and internationally. Located in a cheap city compared to similar ranked universities.
cons: Salary depends on each lab PI. Years of experience are not always taken into consideration. Yearly raises are very low.

job_title: Research Assistant in Saint Louis, MO
pros:
Great flexibility for students (expectation communicated at beginning of hire)
Great research and networking opportunities
Access to publishing (varies by PI/lab)
Great career building opportunities 
Great benefits for full-time employees
cons:
Parking costs are considerably high for employees
Reliance of grant funding/renewal for employment continuation (contract renewal)

review_title: Wash U Medical School Research Patient Coordinator
job_title: Research Patient Coordinator in Saint Louis, MO
pros: A well-respected organization that does good work.  Excellent benefits.  Low key academic environment.  Interesting projects to work on.  Stable - so long as the boss's grants keep coming.
cons: relatively low salary.  Management keeps salaries hush hush.

review_title: Given the reputation and cost of living it's one of the pest places to do postdoc
job_title: Postdoctoral Research Associate in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Prestige, Work life balance, free metro pass,
cons: No 401K for postdocs, not much options to eat around campus,

review_title: Seems like a great place to work
job_title: Executive Secretary in Saint Louis, MO
pros: You earn two days of vacation a month in addition to your sick time and the employer contribution for 401(k) is high.
cons: Do not pay their employees what they should be paid and they are forever underpaid.

job_title: Senior Systems Engineer in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Great benefits and a semi autonomous atmosphere.  great work / life balance atmosphere.  Good place to be to test your hand at new technology.
cons: compensation could be better.  Opportunities for advancement are usually within your own department, it takes networking to move schools / departments.

job_title: Postdoctoral Research Associate in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Good place for research. World-class professors and comprehensive facilities. It's a great place to get advanced training in biology and biomedical fields.
cons: postdoc is not treated as normal staff. Low pay and no accumulated vacations, no contribution to your retirement account. The area around the university is a little dangerous.

job_title: Systems Manager in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Great institution.  Lots of bright associates.
cons: Some unavoidable inconsistencies between units and departments.

review_title: Great university, stingy with lab assistance
job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Great environment with wonderful scientific minds.
cons: Can't get what we need for work. Some things should be covered by indirect costs, which they get a ton of, but they aren't. People end up paying for things like computers out of pocket.

job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator in Saint Louis, MO
pros: The department I work in is great, the doctors are very personable and generous with promotions. Lots of freedom and autonomy. Plus free University courses are great.
cons: Parking sucks, Metrolink sucks! Not a lot of room to advance in Wash U period. Some departments are great and some micro manage.

job_title: Occupational Therapist in Saint Louis, MO
pros:
Flexibility
Academic atmosphere
co-workers 
location - central west end medical campus 
benefits - retirement match, medical, vacation time all great
cons:
Pay - unequal across titles and experience; not comparable to other outpatient 
management
limited room for growth in community practice
no one has been tenured in this program bc of university requirements for physicians

review_title: Lots of opportunity, high stress environment, highest quality research environment
job_title: Research Assistant Professor in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Great benefits, good deans, excellent physical environment, excellent HR, great city
cons: Killer stress, cut throat competition among academics, tolerance of crazy tenured folks, non-parity of pay across gender.

job_title: Computational Fluid Dynamics Researcher in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Nice facilities and people, professors who work with you closely to direct your research in meaningful ways, great networking opportunities, Holmes Lounge Carvery Wraps.
cons: Limited pay, deadlines to meet and papers to write, difficult learning curves to get involved in CFD, no guarantee of future employment,

review_title: I got my PhD from here.
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Saint Louis, MO
pros: A nice university with nice people. I had great friends here. They taught everything in computer science and I leaned a lot.
cons: Too few faculties in the computer science department. Certain areas only have one faculty. Need to expend the department with more faculties.

job_title: Writer in Saint Louis, MO
pros:
Great insurance
Tons of PTO...22 vacation days per year, plus 12 sick days (although you can only use 5 without a doctor's note)
cons:
Doesn't pay well, unless you're at the top level
Advancement varies, but in my department there was very little opportunity to move up

review_title: Interesting work and rewarding to see positive effects employer brings to students and local and global community.
job_title: Administrative Assistant in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Benefits, working with and for students.
cons: In Alumni & Development there is no flexibility in fixed, scheduled work time. Hierarchal culture. Support staff could be better respected, utilized and paid.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Many interesting problems and areas of research, and generally flexible, albeit long, hours. Threat of unionization forced administration to offer medical benefits to more students, improving quality of life.
cons: Fewer opportunities than other graduate schools for nearby company collaboration, usually poor support from PIs to intern with companies.

job_title: Post Doctoral Scholar in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Post-docs are fun, creative jobs involving a mixture of hands on scientific work and deep, thoughtful analysis.
cons: The carrier options for Biomedical PhDs is currently very limited. Considering the long hours, the job pays very little relative to comparably educated individuals in other fields ,

review_title: Your career path is grey at best
job_title: Research Instructor in Saint Louis, MO
pros: It's a great place to do science.
cons: I have not once had a clear view of what my career is going to be. The benchmarks for the next promotion is always unclear. It is unclear what the expectations and rewards are.

job_title: Workstudy Student in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Employers are understanding about class work, interviews for full time, and exams. Simple on-boarding proccess.
cons: Managers will try to hire you as cheaply as possible. Its necessary to negotiate or move on. Difficult part is there may not be another department with an opening to go to.
